SEARCH
Module org.jandle
Package org.jandle.api.http

Interface Request

public interface Request
Represents an immutable view of an incoming HTTP request.

This interface provides access to all request-related data, including:

  • Request metadata (method, path, addresses)
  • Path and query parameters
  • Headers and cookies
  • Request-scoped attributes
  • Request body as raw bytes or parsed JSON

Immutability

Except for request attributes, a Request instance is logically immutable. Methods returning collections or arrays return defensive copies, and modifying them will not affect the underlying request.

Path vs Query Parameters

  • Path parameters are extracted from route templates (e.g. /users/{id})
  • Query parameters are parsed from the URL query string (e.g. ?page=1&sort=asc)

Headers and Cookies

Header and cookie lookup is case-insensitive where applicable, following HTTP specifications.

Request Attributes

Attributes provide a mechanism for filters and handlers to share request-scoped data. They exist only for the lifetime of the request and are not transmitted to the client.

Request Body

The request body may be accessed:
  • As raw bytes via getBodyBytes()
  • As parsed JSON via getBodyJson()

If the Content-Type is not JSON, getBodyJson() returns an empty map.

Thread Safety

Request instances are not required to be thread-safe and are intended to be accessed by a single request-processing thread.
See Also:

  • Response
  • Chain
